As of March 2008, the [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora 9]] distribution has been released with OpenJDK 6 instead of IcedTea<ref name="fedora9redhat" />. Some of the stated reasons for this changes are:
+
As of March 2008, the [[Fedora (operating system)|Fedora 9]] distribution has been released with OpenJDK 6 instead of IcedTea<ref name="fedora9redhat" />. Some of the stated reasons for this changes are:
* Sun has replaced most of the encumbrances for which IcedTea was providing replacements (there is less than 1% of encumbered code in the [[Java Class Library|class library]], and this code is not necessary to run OpenJDK).
* Sun has replaced most of the encumbrances for which IcedTea was providing replacements (there is less than 1% of encumbered code in the [[Java Class Library|class library]], and this code is not necessary to run OpenJDK).
* OpenJDK 6 is a stable branch, whereas OpenJDK 7 is unstable and not expected to ship a stable release until 2009.
* OpenJDK 6 is a stable branch, whereas OpenJDK 7 is unstable and not expected to ship a stable release until 2009.
* Sun has licensed the OpenJDK trademark for use in Fedora.
* Sun has licensed the OpenJDK trademark for use in Fedora.
â
On [[June 2008]], it was announced that [[IcedTea|IcedTea6]] (as the packaged version of OpenJDK on [[Fedora (Linux distribution)|Fedora 9]]) has passed the [[Technology Compatibility Kit]] tests and can claim to be a fully compatible Java 6 implementation<ref>{{cite web
+
